Kptd«to Bushire and Bahrein* Dated New Delhi* 2S*00 hours, 30th December, 1944c Received 22.00 hours, 30th December, 1944* 2 075 ME Addressed London repeated Bushire and Bahrein. John Lean and Sons Glasgow have ready for shipment to Bahrein 4 bales red cotton shav^ls which are reported to be badly needed. We tiaye done all we can to move the traffic but without avail. . . l/e ask you to please believe tuat it is vexav; Jl to us to know that you are in want of goods, and tha^ up to date we have not been able to fulfil your requirements through negligence which is neither our fault nor yo rs' (end of extract.) FOR MINISTRIES ONLY Recommendation for Disposal of Letter and Reason.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 4973/44 'Exports to Arab Sheikdom - assistance to obtain export Licences.'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains an intercepted telegram in which the Postal and Telegraph Censorship adviser paraphrases and quotes a message from John Oakey & Sons Ltd. to another company regarding the stall in a goods shipment of glass, paper, and emery cloth.Also included is a telegram from the Government of India to the Secretary of State for India regarding a shipment of cotton shawls to Bahrain.
